channel.title: How might I go repackaging?
channel.description:
No idea how. Though, I do have some sort of clue. I move the files around into different folders, then, in each file, i put the directory it's in at the top of the file.
Ex:
client.java inside the src file In client.java, I put [code]package src;[/code]
At the top.
Am i right?

item.title: How might I go repackaging?
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

[quote=“Word Life, post:4, topic:358147”][quote author=deathschaos9 link=topic=454654.msg3329139#msg3329139 date=1283345454]

no its import src;

No its

package src;

Packaging a server by hand is going to be a hassle, I suggest you use an IDE, it will allow you to easily package your files.
[/quote]

I have an IDE, Eclipse. But that thing is confusing as fuck. I don’t understand how to use it to package/code my server.[/quote]

use hyperion just because u packaged a winterlove server doesnt mean its going to work better

Read full topic

item.title: How might I go repackaging?
item.dc:creator: @Word_Life Word Life
item.description:
@Word_Life wrote:

Epic Steve:

Right click Default Package -> New -> Package -> Give it a name (Should be lowercase) -> Drag and Drop the files you want in there.

I don’t even know how to load my server files in Eclipse.

Read full topic

item.title: How might I go repackaging?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Right click Default Package -> New -> Package -> Give it a name (Should be lowercase) -> Drag and Drop the files you want in there.
